page.title: 12Yews Farm
page.content: Yews Farm contains 335 acres, plus 4 acres of pasture that was used for pigs, and 2\ acres of wood. Some fields were called "leys"; one field was called a rough ley. The farmer, Mr Crawley, thinks that this is because the field was very bumpy or because it had bushes growing on it. The farm has no animals except the 1000 geese he orders each year. They nest, then Mr Crawley collects the eggs. He eats some himself and sells the others. The geese eat the grass in the field. Then he gets rid of the geese. Unfortunately it was too late this year to order any so he is going to borrow a small flock of about 50 sheep to graze in his small field. It has long grass in it and is an awkward shape so he can't use machinery. There was an orchard of apples and pears near the farmhouse.
